alert.note: Alert for Blount Smoky Mountains; NW Blount; Northwest Monroe; Southeast Monroe (Tennessee) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 30 at 5:29PM CDT by NWS Knoxville
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southwestern Blount and northeastern Monroe Counties through 700 PM EDT... At 629 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 9 miles south of Maryville, moving west at 15 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Maryville, Vonore, Greenback, Friendsville, Citico Beach, Clover Hill, Talassee, Happy Valley and McGee Carson Peninsula. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.

area.areaDesc: Blount Smoky Mountains; NW Blount; Northwest Monroe; Southeast Monroe
